definition[1]: trying extremely hard to achieve what you want
example[0]: He claims he is not a driven workaholic.
definition[2]: if something is petrol-driven, computer-driven etc, it is operated or controlled by petrol, a computer etc
example[1]: Lower interest rates set off computer-driven ‘buy programs’ that sent stocks soaring late in the day.
example[2]: Changes in the regulations will allow the company to sell satellite-driven phone services worldwide.
definition[3]: if something is market-driven, client-driven etc, the market or the client is the main force or influence on it
example[3]: We listen to our customers. We are a client-driven firm.
example[4]: In amarket-driven economy, people are forced to invest by the need to make profits.
example[5]: As the PC market has becomeprice-driven, Compaq’s market share has dropped.
example[6]: Japan is less export-driven than in the past.
